entry.title: Booze on a Cruise Now Costs More for Travelers
entry.content: All-inclusive packages that include alcoholic beverages are a major enticement for some cruise aficionados.

entry.title: The Class of 2023 Faces a Jittery Job Market: 'The World Seems to Have Flipped on Its Head.'
entry.content: Companies from Amazon to Wayfair are tapping the brakes on their hiring of college grads this year, forcing seniors to cast a wider net as they search for that crucial first job.

entry.title: Small Banks Are Losing to Big Banks. Customers Are About to Feel It.
entry.content: Banks too big to fail are gaining deposits: “How can I compete for new business with that big enchilada out there?”

entry.title: Apple Wants to Solve One of Music's Biggest Problems
entry.content: Forget the metaverse. The future is metadata. It’s how the world’s most valuable company built a better way of listening to Mozart and Beethoven.

entry.title: Hong Kong Arrests Show No Letup in Beijing-Driven Crackdown on Dissent
entry.content: The arrest of a Hong Kong labor activist on national security grounds suggests Beijing is unlikely to relent on its drive to root out dissent the international financial center.
